channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: GOP, say yes to workplace equality
item.description: Donna Brazile says House Republicans should look to the Declaration of Independence and pass the Employment Non-Discrimination Act.

item.title: This movie too sexy for your kid to see
item.description: The film "Blue Is the Warmest Color," a French import, has kicked up a storm of controversy, mostly because of its extraordinarily long, detailed and explicit lesbian sexual and romantic scenes. So graphic was a roughly six-minute coupling, that the Motion Picture Association of America gave the movie an NC-17 rating, that is, no one under 17 admitted.

item.title: Cops stun-gun dad, son dies in fire
item.description: Police stun and handcuff a father who attempted to go into his burning home to save his 3-year-old son.

item.title: Boy bullied over shoes, but then ...
item.description: A boy wears pink sneakers in honor of his mother and gets bullied for it; his friends show their support.

item.title: Funny or Die: This iPhone costs $25
item.description: The new iPhone cost too much? Then the iPhone 5F may be for you. Watch more at http://www.funnyordie.com.

item.title: 10 surprising Berlin Wall locations
item.description: Little of the Berlin Wall survives today in the German capital.

item.title: Ground zero for super typhoon
item.description: Bodies are washing up on Tacloban's beaches. Kids have been ripped from their father's arms. Every building appears to be damaged.

item.title: 1,200 may be dead
item.description: Officials found more than 100 bodies scattered on the streets of one coastal city. Bodies also were found at a chapel.

item.title: Storm chaser: Like a disaster movie
item.description: It was the cruelest of ironies unleashed by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

item.title: CNN crew caught in flood waters
item.description: CNN Producer Tim Schwarz and CNNI Anchor Andrew Stevens help rescue people inside a hotel during Typhoon Haiyan.

item.title: Kids ripped from parents' arms
item.description: Super Typhoon Haiyan has killed an estimated 1,200 people in the Philippines, according to the Red Cross.

item.title: Photos
4 reasons Democrats are nervous
item.description: Quick, can you hear it? That creaking sound from Washington is the nerves of congressional Democrats in response to the political firestorm raging around Obamacare.

item.title: GOP civil war could be brutal
item.description: There's a fight brewing and it could get ugly. In one corner is the Republican Party. And in the other ... the Republican Party.

item.title: Will feds follow states, make pot legal?
item.description: Marijuana is moving on "greased tracks" toward legalization, according to the advocacy group that's been riding the train for more than 40 years.

item.title: Pot to mint more than microsoft?
item.description: Legal marijuana entrpreneur Jamen Shively talks with CNN's Don Lemon about pot's market potential.

item.title: New clues in porch shooting
item.description: A family says their 19-year-old was shot and killed after seeking help following a car accident. Nic Robertson reports.

item.title: CBS: 'We were wrong' on Benghazi
item.description: CBS News says it is investigating whether a key source "misled us" in a report that raised doubts about the Obama administration's response to the attack on the U.S. diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.

item.title: Jordan's home sold for how much?
item.description: NBA legend Michael Jordan's house will be sold at auction after it failed to sell for the $21 million asking price.

item.title: Gangs of thieves attack stores
item.description: A group of people have been taking entire racks of clothing out of Sports Authority stores in the Chicago area.

item.title: Watch mayor's drunken rant
item.description: Video obtained by the Toronto Star shows embattled Mayor Rob Ford making violent threats about some unknown person.

item.title: You want schools to do THIS?
item.description: Schools are cracking down on cyber-bullying by monitoring student behavior on social media.

item.title: Schools' anti-Semitism 'out of control'?
item.description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo directed state police and the Division of Human Rights on Friday to investigate allegations of anti-Semitic harassment in a New York state school district.

item.title: Falling satellite still sending info
item.description: The 2,000-pound Gravity Field and Steady-State Ocean Explorer -- a European Space Agency satellite known shorthand as GOCE-- continued its freefall Saturday, dropping an estimated 13 kilometers (8 miles) over the course of the day. That's a pretty good clip, but it's still got a ways to go: A scientist says it'll probably have its final entry into the Earth's orbit in "less than two days."

item.title: Inside a 'sophisticated' drug tunnel
item.description: Miguel Marquez tours a drug tunnel dug between Tijuana and San Diego that contained both lights and ventilation.

item.title: Jury: Doctor drugged, drowned wife
item.description: A jury found ex-doctor Martin MacNeill guilty of murdering his wife so he could be with his mistress.

item.title: 11 indicted in biker-SUV driver clash
item.description: A grand jury indicted 11 bikers, including an undercover New York City police detective, in connection with a well-publicized clash with an SUV driver, according to the Friday indictment.

item.title: Mom targets baby-bashing group
item.description: A Florida mom stumbled onto a secret Facebook group page that made fun of the pictures of other people's children.

item.title: Trans fat: The FDA says trans fats are no longer recognized as safe.
item.description: The FDA says trans fats are no longer recognized as safe.

item.title: Ellsberg: He's a hero
item.description: Daniel Ellsberg tells CNN's Don Lemon that NSA leaker Edward Snowden showed courage, has done an enormous service.

item.title: Man turns himself in, dies in jail
item.description: Michael Saffioti died in jail after eating oatmeal due to a dairy allergy and his family is now suing for $10 million.

item.title: Alzheimer's risk: Do you want to know?
item.description: Is it useful or meaningful to know that you could be 15 years away from developing Alzheimer's disease?

item.title: Marilyn Manson seen without makeup
item.description: You won't believe what goth rocker Marilyn Manson looks like without makeup. HLN's A.J. Hammer reports.

item.title: Mom: Hospital staff left 'loser' note
item.description: A mom says a South Carolina hospital left a note describing her baby as a "loser" because of a lack of immunizations.

item.title: Yes, airline seats are smaller
item.description: You're not imagining it, airline seats are getting smaller.

item.title: Model's shocking transformation
item.description: Elliott Sailors, a female model, is now modeling as a man and posing in menswear.

item.title: Body modification -- or mutilation?
item.description: Horns. Forked tongues. Elf ears. Whiskers.

item.title: Track star refuses to wear this in race
item.description: A high school track athlete cites religious beliefs for refusing to wear the number "666" at a track meet.

item.title: Is this Photoshop editing gone too far?
item.description: A time lapse video of model Sally Gifford Piper created to show the extensive use of Photoshop editing has gone viral.

item.title: Iran talks end; no deal
item.description: Three days of diplomatic talks on Iran's nuclear program have concluded without an agreement. "But we made significant progress," U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry says.

item.title: Martin MacNeill, Utah doctor, found guilty of murder of his wife
item.description: Utah doctor Martin MacNeill was found guilty of his wife's murder in a verdict early Saturday morning.

item.title: Real gun from printer
item.description: Solid Concepts said in a blog post it has fired more than 50 rounds from the metal handgun, produced using a 3-D printer.

item.title: Super Typhoon Haiyan grounds hundreds of flights
item.description: Hundreds of flights have been grounded in the Philippines, where Super Typhoon Haiyan made landfall Friday morning.

item.title: Iran talks end; no deal
item.description: Three days of diplomatic talks on Iran's nuclear program have concluded without an agreement. "But we made significant progress," U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry says.

item.title: Parties remain optimistic
item.description: No deal has been made on Iran's nuclear program, but optimism remains. CNN's Karl Penhaul reports.

item.title: Typhoon
item.description: A day after Super Typhoon Haiyan roared into the Philippines, officials predicted that the death toll could reach 1,200 -- or more.

item.title: Kendrick Johnson
item.description: The coroner in the case of a Georgia teen found dead inside a rolled-up gym mat has blasted the initial investigation.

item.title: Jonathan Martin
item.description: Vulgar comments, some laced with racial epithets. A physical attack. Threats to him and his family.

item.title: Active asteroid
item.description: What's that in the sky? Is it an asteroid? A comet? A lawn sprinkler?

item.title: Falling satellite
item.description: A European satellite that ran out of fuel will start falling in the next few days, and fragments of the disintegrating 2,000-pound spacecraft are expected to strike the Earth's surface.
